revised_title: Reproductive Anatomy and Development of the Female African Elephant
tldr: This study examines the reproductive organs and development of the female African elephant. The external genitalia are characterized by the position of the vulva and a long urogenital canal. The reproductive tract's internal structure is described, including the ovaries and associated peritoneal structures. The research is based on the dissection of several foetal specimens and one young calf, supplementing previous work on the subject.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Reproductive Biology
